sub_topic: The construction of the Heighway dragon curve.
message_1: What is the perimeter of the Heighway dragon curve after the 8th iteration, if the starting line segment has a length of 1 unit?
message_2:
The Heighway dragon curve is a fractal that is created by folding a strip of paper in half repeatedly and then unfolding it so that each fold creates a 90-degree angle. The perimeter of the curve increases with each iteration.

After the first iteration, the perimeter is 2 units (the original line segment plus one more of the same length). With each subsequent iteration, the perimeter doubles. So, after the 8th iteration, the perimeter will be:

Perimeter = Initial length × 2^(Number of iterations)
Perimeter = 1 × 2^8
Perimeter = 1 × 256
Perimeter = 256 units

So, the perimeter of the Heighway dragon curve after the 8th iteration is 256 units.
